DataElement.preferredName: T-Cell Receptor Signaling Defect Description Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of the T-Cell Receptor (TCR) signaling defect.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An indication that T-cell receptor (TCR)-dependent signaling pathways in a immunologic sample are compromised. TCR signaling defects lead to impaired development of T-lymphocytes and are usually caused by deletion or loss of function mutations affecting one or more proteins involved in TCR-dependent signaling pathways, including the subunits of the TCR complex._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An indication that T-cell receptor (TCR)-dependent signaling pathways in a immunologic sample are compromised. TCR signaling defects lead to impaired development of T-lymphocytes and are usually caused by deletion or loss of function mutations affecting one or more proteins involved in TCR-dependent signaling pathways, including the subunits of the TCR complex.

Concepts.definition: An indication that T-cell receptor (TCR)-dependent signaling pathways in a immunologic sample are compromised. TCR signaling defects lead to impaired development of T-lymphocytes and are usually caused by deletion or loss of function mutations affecting one or more proteins involved in TCR-dependent signaling pathways, including the subunits of the TCR complex.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statement or an account describing something.

Concepts.definition: A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text entry of 100 character maximum length.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
